posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
I have been searching for sometime to identify a build in which a half-orc would be the most optimal race for a build. 

Dwarves and humans seem to have a monopoly over what is most optimal.

Perhaps a Fighter / Pale Master might be a build in which half-orcs are the most optimal?

Pale Master builds tend to struggle with AB so the extra Str would be helpful.




This was the best I could come up with, a 45 AB Palemaster with dev crit, epic warding and 38 AC in mundane plate / tower. 

It's got a 20% exp penalty from level 12. 

If you dont want dev crit then simply drop overwhelming and devastating critical and rearrange the feats to take two Great Strengths to push the AB to 46.

If you want Epic Mage Armor, one can swap Epic Prowess for a Great Strength Feat, and take EMA as a general feat at level 39 dropping the AB by 1.

posts.content:

Orion2019:
I have been searching for sometime to identify a build in which a half-orc would be the most optimal race for a build.
Noble goal!

Sadly... this draft is illegal. Epic spells require 15+ spellcraft (Epic Mage Armor - 26; Epic Warding - 34!).
03: Fighter(3): Weapon Proficiency (Exotic)
I recommend LOH or Great fortitude (or start with 15 DEX and focus in Double Ax like true (half)orc! (You know... Ax good, Double Ax better)).

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hello zg1k!

He is indeed a very noble half-orc, and has worked hard to be smarter than most!

Great comment on spellcraft, I forgot the spellcraft requirement.

Very simple fix, increase Int to 14 and reduce Cons to 12. Use the remaining skill points to max spellcraft. Still has over 400hp so its all fine. 


I agree taking LoH would possibly be more optimal, although being able to use any weapon in the game is also pretty useful too. I get annoyed by all those cool bastard swords that drop that I want to wield!

Anyway I made the change to put LoH in because why not. 

Dual wielding a Double Axe would be interesting but the Dex to 15 requirement would mean finding 7 additional stat points, I viewed it as less powerful, dual wielding drops the AB by 2, also some reduced damage output against damage resistant opponents albeit offset by epic weapon specialisation and dev crit

Thanks for your comments on my draft!

But...

Maybe I'm complaining too much. It's just easier to build a half orc half dragon.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Good old fighter / bard / rdd, it is such a powerful combination. Dev crit at level 21!!!! Str 40 and Base AB 47 without trying!

Yes pale master gets Crit Immunity and EMA and/or Epic Warding which is the main good thing about it, its more 'tanky'. I like the fact the current build I made has 34 strength, dev crit and base 45 AB as well!

I think one could drop discipline in favor of concentration in this build on WoG, but if I did it officially I might get in trouble with the ECB moderators for building for a specific environment (the builds are meant to be applicable 'in general' according to the rules I have read from the original forum) but yes just put on some knockdown immune boots (or helmet with UMD) and no need for discipline skill without any decent disarming enemies. Every third enemy on WoG seems to taunt me so that is a reasonable call. (Every second enemy and his dog casts greater dispelling on me)

I wouldn't drop the strength any further. Half-orc is special for its 'high strength' and I wouldn't want to lose that special part of this build. For skill points human wins hands down sadly :)

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Orion2019 wrote:if I did it officially I might get in trouble with the ECB moderators for building for a specific environment 
The main rule here is that the builds shall be general and not specific. 
That being said, we sometimes get requests, and even make builds geared towards specific servers or modules. The most frequent server in that respect is the lvl 30 PW, Arelith. And it is no secret that many of our builders are heavily influenced by the challenging environment on WoG too.
But if you make a build or a variant of a build geared towards a specific environment, you should be explicit about it, just so there is no doubt about what the purpose of the build or tweak is.
